citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
During this inspection, the facility representative was unable to locate and provide the written program of veterinary care
or the contingency plan for review. Since these documents were unavailable they could not be reviewed. These
documents are necessary to review to ensure that the exhibit animals are provided with appropriate veterinary care and
that there is an adequate plan in place to protect the animals during cases of emergencies.
Each dealer, exhibitor, intermediate handler, or carrier, shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials:
(a)(2) To examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations in this part;
The facility shall provide and make available, during inspections, the program of veterinary care and contingency plan.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: FEBRUARY 12, 2025

While approaching the enclosure, the odor of feces was present in the ambient air. Upon further observation, urine and
several piles of fecal matter were present in the front, right corner of the cat exhibit. The accumulations appear to be days
old. These areas of cat waste must be removed and the area cleaned and sanitized to prevent contamination.
Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals
contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: FEBRUARY 2, 2025.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
During this inspection, the facility representative was unable to locate and provide the written program of veterinary care 
or the contingency plan for review. Since these documents were unavailable they could not be reviewed. These 
documents are necessary to review to ensure that the exhibit animals are provided with appropriate veterinary care and 
that there is an adequate plan in place to protect the animals during cases of emergencies.  
 
Each dealer, exhibitor, intermediate handler, or carrier, shall, during business hours, allow APHIS officials: 
 
(a)(2) To examine records required to be kept by the Act and the regulations in this part;  
 
The facility shall provide and make available, during inspections, the program of veterinary care and contingency plan. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: FEBRUARY 12, 2025 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
While approaching the enclosure, the odor of feces was present in the ambient air. Upon further observation, urine and 
several piles of fecal matter were present in the front, right corner of the cat exhibit. The accumulations appear to be days 
old. These areas of cat waste must be removed and the area cleaned and sanitized to prevent contamination. 
 
Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals 
contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to reduce odors. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY: FEBRUARY 2, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the facility representative.
